sentence.Network_en: The racoons knock over the rubbish bins in search of food, and strew the contents all over the ground.
sentence.Network_cn: 浣熊弄翻垃圾箱找吃的，把垃圾弄得满地都是。

sentence.Network_en: Their custom is to strew flowers over the graves.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们的风俗是在坟墓上撒花.

sentence.Network_en: Get up, or I'll strew your brains upon the grass.
sentence.Network_cn: 起来, 否则我就把你的脑浆洒在这草地上.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English stre(o)wian, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch strooien, German streuen, from an Indo-European root shared by Latin sternere 'lay flat'

entry.tran: 撒;散播;在…上布满(或撒满)
entry.def: To strew things somewhere, or to strew a place with things, means to scatter them there.

example.ex: The racoons knock over the rubbish bins in search of food, and strew the contents all over the ground...
example.tran: 浣熊弄翻垃圾箱找吃的，把垃圾弄得满地都是。

example.ex: An elderly woman was strewing the floor with French chalk so that the dancing shoes would not slip...
example.tran: 一位老妇人正在往地板上撒滑石粉以防止舞鞋打滑。

sentences.en: The floor was strewn with clothes.
The way ahead is strewn with difficulties.
